text:
977-979 First Avenue at S.W. corner of 54th Street. December 6, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
First Avenue, west side, between 54th and 55th Streets.
December 6, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, including the corner of 55th Street, showing 1001-03 First Avenue in the last stages of demolition.
On this site a fifteen-story apartment house is to be erected as soon as possible. At the time of these pictures the Sutton Place and East 57th Street real estate boom, of which this is a part, was nicely under way.
December 6, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
First Avenue, west side, between 54th and 55th Streets.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, including the corner of 55th Street, showing 1001-03 First Avenue in the last stages of demolition.
On this site a fifteen-story apartment house is to be erected as soon as possible. At the time of these pictures the Sutton Place and East 57th Street real estate boom, of which this is a part, was nicely under way.
December 6, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

351-353 East 54th Street, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of First Ave. Building between these two houses (No. 351 "A") is a 2-story frame house, bearing no number.

September 20, 1927,

P. L. Sperr.

54th Street, north side, east from and including First Ave.

June 23, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

First Avenue (right foreground), at the N.W. corner of E. 54th Street, showing East Side tenements against a back drop of Fifth Avenue hotels. The most prominent of these is the Ritz Tower. To the right and left respectively are the Pierre and the Savoy-Plaza. In the center is the Hotel Delmonico. Note the excavation in the right foreground and upon which will rise a modern apartment house as one of the forerunners of the rehabilitation of this Beekman Hill section.

January 7, 1928

P. L. Sperr

54th Street, west of First Ave., showing prominently the north side. At Second Ave. appears an elevated line. Shown on the right is a 4-story structure at the N.W. corner that bears Nos. 985 First Ave. and 353 East 54th Street.

March 20, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.
